conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to understand the thermodynamic processes involved.
The image is a p-V diagram showing two adiabatic processes (a-c and c-b) and two isochoric processes (b-d and d-a).
The problem involves comparing the internal energy of an ideal gas at states a and c.
Identify adiabatic processes a-c and c-b where no heat transfer occurs, keeping internal energy constant.
For an ideal gas, internal energy is a function of temperature only.
Since internal energy is constant during adiabatic processes, internal energy at state a equals internal energy at state c.
Identify isochoric processes b-d and d-a where volume remains constant.
Internal energy remains constant during isochoric processes as well.
The internal energy at states a and c is the same.
